Posts.Content: Thank you all for your honest responses- I was hoping to hear how others in our situation have coped. And someone with a high sex drive like myself. I agree that we need to continue to try and figure it out. (which is what brought me here). We never sought counseling after or talked to anyone in our situation after the procedures.... this is the first time we are reaching out to others. Maybe the doctors should have suggested counseling (especially with a couple like us who are so young!). His surgery was a few years ago and then he had to have radiation about a year or so following. We have not tried injections.... our question on that is it seems the research shows that with the injections it might not be “big” enough to actually have intercourse..... anyone have thoughts on that. What would you try (injections or something else?) I dont want to put him through something like this unless its really going to have an impact on us (in a positive way) I know it seems on the outside cold and shallow etc to want to step out.....if you knew us you would know we love each other very much.... but it is hard living in a body that craves what it does, and oral can be amazing but unfortunately i crave more than that...... i struggle every day to stay true...and it has nothing to do with my love for him. Though I guess it seems to read that way. FYI I am sharing these posts with my husband. We are in this together. It’s not easy admitting this problem or admitting that I have these needs. I know it is hurting him...and I feel TERRIBLE GUILT about that. He is the last person I want to hurt and I am very thankful that for now he is cancer free. But we are human and these are real and honest concerns that won’t just go away because I wish them to...... its a struggle and we know we need help.
Posts.Title: No Sexual Function- She has High Sex Drive- Help!

Posts.Content: My husband is saying its very hard to read this..... b/c its very real to us.... some of the posts hurt each of us in a different way. Like he said If someone is in a car accident and dies you feel bad for the spouse that lives and what they are going through, but you dont really understand the impact of that until you live it. While reading these posts we are living it. Its tough to put yourself out there with our real issues. We appreciate the support and any advice for how you have made it work in your marriage.

Posts.Title: No Sexual Function- She has High Sex Drive- Help!

Posts.Content: My husband and I have been married over 17 years. We are the best of friends. Our children are our world. Several years ago he was diagnosed with Prostate Cancer. The doctors felt b/c he was so young (early 40's) his sexual function would come back.... but it never did. So here we are..... Some women might be fine with it, and some men might feel if you love him than just deal with it and be thankful you still have him. I agree with all of that, but the problem is I have a VERY high sex drive and I'm 40. I love my husband so much but I'm having a hard time staying faithful. I wanted him to say that I could go out of the marriage now and then to fill the need I have. its just sex....Its him I love...but he loves me very much and doesn't want to share me. We are going to seek counseling but I wanted to see if there were other couples having the same issues and what did you do about it?

Posts.Title: No Sexual Function- She has High Sex Drive- Help!

Posts.Content: We had a great surgeon but in the end my husband has ended up with no sexual function VERY VERY Difficult for both of us. As we are young (40’s) ...... slow and steady and ask questions. Good luck.
Posts.Title: 44yrs old with prostate cancer.

Posts.Content: We had a great surgeon but in the end my husband has ended up with no sexual function VERY VERY Difficult for both of us. As we are young (40’s) ...... slow and steady and ask questions. Good luck.
Posts.Title: 44yrs old with prostate cancer.

Posts.Content: Hi we are a young couple 46/40. Husband had surgery for Prostate Cancer 2010, with Radiation in 2011 b/c it was still detectable. He had Erectile Disfunction after the surgery and it never came back. Today we met with a eurologist and the doctor who performed the surgery. The suggestion was to try Viagra first, then Cialias. If those dont work then they suggested Prostaglandon E1. We dont want him to end up in the hospital with an erection that wont go away. What are your thoughts on all of this? Thank you in advance.
Posts.Title: Post Surgery Post Radiation - Doctors Suggestions for ED
